roleset.name: go on the lam
roleset.note: LAM-V NOTES: Framed by Julia based on Brown. This verb has no definitions in any dictionaries that I've found, but based on internet examples, it appears to have to do with going on the lam. No VNcls. No full comparison, but partial comparison to 'hide' (from lam.01-v)

roles.note: Pay attention to the tree and directional prepositional phrases-- if 'out' is part of a directional or destinational PP, use lam.01. If it's treed like a particle, use lam.02. (from lam.01-v)

example.name: With direction- source
example.text: I'm grabbing my kerosene-powered laptop and lamming out of here as far as my Hupmobile will carry me.
example.arg: as far as my Hupmobile will carry me

example.name: with 'it'
example.text: The last time I ate at Arterra, its then nearly new head chef lammed it out the back door and ran home to Pittsburgh.
example.arg: its then nearly new head chef

example.name: all args
example.text: I 'd never lammed it from the cops before, but I figured now was the time to learn how.

roleset.name: lam out: go on the lam
roleset.note: LAM_OUT-V NOTES: Framed by Julia based on Brown. This verb has no definitions in any dictionaries that I've found, but based on internet examples, it appears to have to do with going on the lam. No VNcls. No full comparison, but partial comparison to 'hide_out' (from lam.02-v)

roles.note: Pay attention to the tree and directional prepositional phrases-- if 'out' is part of a directional or destinational PP, use lam.01. If it's treed like a particle, use lam.02. (from lam.02-v)

example.name: lam out with your ham out (I have no idea)
example.text: There 's no way to take him in now and keep [those other two -- Wister and the one who hired the two of them --]-1 from *T*-1 finding out about Roberts and lamming out .
example.arg: *T*-1: [those other two -- Wister and the one who hired the two of them --]

example.name: with arg2, the law
example.text: [The dark-haired stud]-1 is too busy *T*-1 lamming out from the law for some murder he committed back on the Big Island .
example.arg: for some murder he committed back on the Big Island

example.name: with location
example.text: Grabbing a degree in literature before *PRO* lamming out all over the world to live the life of the itinerant jazzman
example.arg: to live the life of the itinerant jazzman

example.name: with arg1 and GOL
example.text: He lammed it out to the western territories for a few years.
